com.futurice.cascade.util

Class AbstractThreadType

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.futurice.cascade.util.AbstractThreadType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INamed, IThreadType
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultThreadType

    public abstract class AbstractThreadType
extends java.lang.Object
implements IThreadType, INamed
    The baseline implementation of ThreadType convenience classes. It provides functional interfaces (lambda-friendly if you are using the RetroLambda library or similar) to execRunnable code in a background WORKER thread pool.

    For more specialized behaviour a class may choose to replace this.

    TODO Add a DEBUG build timer which notifies you of dangling forks (.subscribe() which you forget to call .fork() on after some time period)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractThreadType

        public AbstractThreadType(java.lang.String name,
                          java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executorService,
                          java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<java.lang.Runnable> queue)
        Create an asynchronous onFireAction handler that embodies certain rules for threading split concurrency in a set of lambda-friendly methods
        Parameters:
        executorService - the thread or thread pool for this thread type. Threads and thread pools may be shared with other thread types, however note that though this this cooperative execution reduces context switching and peak memory load it may delay the start of execution of tasks in one thread type by tasks in another thread type

      • executeNext

        public <IN> void executeNext(IAction<IN> action)
        Description copied from interface: IThreadType
        If this ThreadType permits out-of-order execution, execute this onFireAction before any previously submitted tasks. This is a LIFO onFireAction. Think of it as a "high priority" or "depth first" solution to complete a sequence of actions already started before opening a new sequence of actions.

        If this ThreadType does not permit out-of-order execution, this will become a IThreadType.execute(IAction) FIFO onFireAction.

        Specified by:
        executeNext in interface IThreadType
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the type of input argument expected by the action
        Parameters:
        action - the work to be performed

      • moveToHeadOfQueue

        public boolean moveToHeadOfQueue(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Description copied from interface: IThreadType
        The same as IThreadType.executeNext(IAction), however it is only moved if it is already in the queue. If it is not found in the queue, it will not be added.

        This is useful as part singleton executor patterns where an action that can be queued multiple times should be executing or queued only once at any given time.

        Specified by:
        moveToHeadOfQueue in interface IThreadType
        Parameters:
        runnable - the work to be performed
        Returns:
        true if found in the queue and moved

        public <IN> IAltFuture<?,IN> from(IN value)
        Description copied from interface: IThreadType
        Set the chain value to a value which can be determined at the time the chain is built. This is most suitable for starting a chain. It is also useful to continue other actions after some initial onFireAction or actions complete, but those use values that for example you may set by using closure values at chain construction time.

      • fork

        public <IN,OUT> void fork(IRunnableAltFuture<IN,OUT> runnableAltFuture)
        Description copied from interface: IThreadType
        Place this the IRunnableAltFuture implementation such as the default AltFuture in to an execution queue associated with this IThreadType.

        You generally do not call this directly, but rather call IAltFuture.fork() so that it can check and adjust state and call this on its specified IThreadTypefor you.

        Specified by:
        fork in interface IThreadType
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the type of input argument expected by the action
        OUT - the type of output returned by the action
        Parameters:
        runnableAltFuture - the holder for an evaluate-once-a-discard function which is ready to be queued because it can now be evaluated in a non-blocking manner

      • shutdown

        public <IN> java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> shutdown(long timeout,
                                                                    IAction<IN> afterShutdownAction)
        Description copied from interface: IThreadType
        Wait for all pending actions to complete. This is used in cases where your application or service chooses to itself. In such cases you can wait an arbitrary amount of time for the orderly completion of any pending tasks split execute some onFireAction once this finishes.

        Under normal circumstances, you do call this. Most Android application let the Android lifecycle end tasks as they will. Just let work complete split let Android end the program when it feels the need. This is the safest design Android offers since there are no guarantees your application will change Android execute states with graceful notification. Design for split battle harden your code against sudden shutdowns instead of expecting this method to be called.

        This method returns immediately split does not wait. It will start to shut down the executor threads. No more asynchronous tasks may be sent to the executor after this point.

        Use the returned Future to know when current tasks complete.

        // Do not get from a thread of the ExecutorService or it will prevent shutdown shutdown(5000, () -> doSomethingAfterShutdown()).get(); // Block calling thread up to 5 seconds

        After shutdown starts, new WORKER operations (operations queued to a WORKER) will throw a runtime Exception.

        Note that you must kill the Program or Service using ALog after shutdown. It can not be restarted even if for example a new Activity is created later without first reacting a new Program.

        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface IThreadType
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the type of input argument expected by the action
        Parameters:
        timeout - length of time to wait for shutdown to complete normally before forcing completion
        afterShutdownAction - start on a dedicated thread after successful shutdown. The returned Future will complete only after this operation completes split afterShutdownAction will not be called
        Returns:
        a Future that will return true if the shutdown completes within the specified time, otherwise shutdown continues

      • shutdownNow

        public <IN> java.util.List<java.lang.Runnable> shutdownNow(java.lang.String reason,
                                                           IAction<IN> actionOnDedicatedThreadAfterAlreadyStartedTasksComplete,
                                                           IAction<IN> actionOnDedicatedThreadIfTimeout,
                                                           long timeoutMillis)
        Description copied from interface: IThreadType
        Halt execution of all functional and reactive subscriptions in this threadType.
        Specified by:
        shutdownNow in interface IThreadType
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the type of input argument expected by the action
        Parameters:
        reason - An explanation to track to the source for debugging the clear cause for cancelling all functional chain elements and unbinding all reactive chain elements which have not otherwise expired.
        actionOnDedicatedThreadAfterAlreadyStartedTasksComplete - optional callback once current tasks completely finished
        actionOnDedicatedThreadIfTimeout - optional what to do if an already started task blocks for too long
        timeoutMillis - length of time to wait for shutdown to complete normally before forcing completion
        Returns:
        a list of work which failed to complete before shutdown
